title: Hispanic and Latinx Issues in Global Health
description: This course aims to provide an educational setting for Latinx/Hispanic students to discuss critical perspectives in global health. The purpose is to think critically and creatively about global health development from an interdisciplinary approach. Themes to explore include research methodologies from decolonial perspectives, the role of morals and values in policy development, and the challenges of tackling global health problems in neoliberal societies.
